author: Digital Foundry
description:
Digital Foundry is now fully independent! Join the DF Supporter Program and support the team: https://bit.ly/3jEGjvx

Bloober Team's Layers of Fear has reached Nintendo Switch 2 - and with it, an interesting surprise. To the best of our knowledge, it's the first Switch 2 title running on Unreal Engine 5 using the computationally taxing Lumen global illumination system, the software-driven ray tracing solution developed by Epic. What's more, the game is targeting 60 frames per second. Oliver and Alex compare notes - what new information have we learned about UE5 on Switch 2?

Visit the new Digital Foundry website: https://www.digitalfoundry.net

Go here to check out DF merch! https://store.digitalfoundry.net

Subscribe for more Digital Foundry: http://bit.ly/DFSubscribe

00:00 Overview
00:54 Lumen: UE5 ray tracing on Switch 2
04:10 Lumen cuts and compromises 
15:34 Visual settings, image quality, and performance 
19:49 What does Layers of Fear tell us about UE5 on Switch 2?
title: Layers of Fear Switch 2 Review: UE5 Lumen Ray Tracing Targeting 60FPS!
